required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Cesarean Section Experience Through Hypnotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Cesarean Section Experience Through Hypnotherapy: a Prospective Single Center Case-control Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis

clinical_study.source: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis

brief_summary.textblock: Cesarean section rates continue to increase worldwide, particularly in middle- and high-income countries. In France, the rate has now stabilized around 20 %. Cesarean section is a particular way of giving birth, sometimes desired, but sometimes feared. If some women do not feel affected by this way of giving birth, it is more difficult for others to live with. In this way, not being able to give birth trough natural way may be disturbing in motherhood. At La Rochelle hospital, more than 230 healthcare providers have been trained according to Erickson's hypnosis methodology. Among them, 40 are part of the anesthesia department and a committee oversees the hypnotherapist activities in pain management. The objective of the present study is to assess the benefit of hypnosis session for improving experience and reducing anxiety in women giving birth through surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: Nonpharmacological approaches for pain management, either as a primary method or as a complement to pharmacological approaches, are suggested for a better perinatal management. The investigators assessed the use of conversational hypnotic induction and therapeutic suggestions during cesarean section as a complement to pharmacological strategy. Women giving birth through scheduled or unplanned cesarean section and who accepted hypnotherapy session were compared to a control group.

primary_outcome.measure: Wellbeing Measured Using a Comfort Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: just after surgery, up to 1 hour
primary_outcome.description: The comfort scale is a numeric rating scale ranging from 0 to 10 : 0 corresponds to "no comfort" and 10 corresponds to "most comfortable".

secondary_outcome.measure: Wellbeing Measured Using a Comfort Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The comfort scale is a numeric rating scale ranging from 0 to 10 : 0 corresponds to "no comfort" and 10 corresponds to "most comfortable".

secondary_outcome.measure: Wellbeing Measured Using a Comfort Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The comfort scale is a numeric rating scale ranging from 0 to 10 : 0 corresponds to "no comfort" and 10 corresponds to "most comfortable".

secondary_outcome.measure: Score at Numeric Pain Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: just after surgery, up to 1 hour
secondary_outcome.description: The numeric pain rating scale ranges from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Score at Numeric Pain Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The numeric pain rating scale ranges from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.measure: Score at Numeric Pain Rating Scale
secondary_outcome.description: The numeric pain rating scale range from 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: for 2 hours in the recovery room at regular intervals (average)
for 2 hours in the recovery room at regular intervals (average)

arm_group.description: women who attended the obstetrics department for a scheduled or unplanned cesarean section and who benefited from general care
women who attended the obstetrics department for a scheduled or unplanned cesarean section and who benefited from a hypnosis session during the surgery in addition to general care

intervention.description: Conversational hypnotic induction and therapeutic suggestions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- over 18
- scheduled or unplanned cesarean section
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of the patient to participate in the study
- Not French speaking
- Patients under guardianship

overall_official.affiliation: Groupe Hospitalier de la Rochelle Ré Aunis

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
